channel.title: STA 331 2.0 Stochastic Processes
channel.description: Recent content on STA 331 2.0 Stochastic Processes

item.title: About
item.description: The word stochastic is jargon for random. Many systems evolve over time with an inherent amount of randomness. A stochastic process is a system which evolves in time or space while undergoing chance fluctuations. We can describe such a system by defining a family of random variables. The objective of this course unit is to introduce the theory of stochastic processes, in particular Markov processes. The theory is illustrated with examples from operations research, biology, finance and economy.
